shortdesc.ph: Sets the audio data format for playback.

p.codeblock: public abstract int setPlaybackAudioFrameParameters( int sampleRate, int channel, int mode, int samplesPerCall);
virtual int setPlaybackAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall) = 0;
UFUNCTION(BlueprintCallable, Category = "Agora|RtcEngineProxy") int SetPlaybackAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, ERAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall);
public abstract int SetPlaybackAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall);
Future<void> setPlaybackAudioFrameParameters( {required int sampleRate, required int channel, required RawAudioFrameOpModeType mode, required int samplesPerCall});

section.title: Details
section.p: Sets the data format for the callback.

ul.li: Ensure that you call this method before joining a channel.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval based on the samplesPerCall, sampleRate and channel parameters set in this method.Sample interval (sec) = samplePerCall/(sampleRate × channel). Ensure that the sample interval ≥ 0.01 (s). The SDK triggers the callback according to the sampling interval.

plentry.pd: The sample rate returned in the callback, which can be set as 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000 Hz.

pd.p:
The number of channels returned in the callback:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.

p.props: ios mac cpp unreal bp unity flutter electron rn cs

pd.p: The use mode of the audio frame. See .

plentry.pd: The number of data samples returned in the callback, such as 1024 for the Media Push.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.

li.props: native unreal bp unity electron rn cs

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
